datafield.subfield: Three legal treatises on civil and ecclesiastical law, with medicinal recipes, and notes and accounts related to the quartering of soldiers, probably in and near Hertfordshire (Broxbourne, Hoddesdon, and Epping), dated from 1639-1647 :
Unrestricted, for either reading room or classroom use.

In addition to accounts owed to John Jarsey (fol. 1r-16v), contents include:1. fol. 17r-34v: Anonymous collection of seventy-nine questions and answers related to inheritance of property, beginning How beganne estates in Lands and Tenements and ending with a section May Charters be graunted from one to another.2. fol. 35r-78r: Bacon, Francis, Sir (1561-1626). The Use of the Law set out in ninety-seven paragraphs; not attributed to Bacon, and headed Certaine principles gathered out of the Lawe. Signed Finis per me Richard Sowerbutts esq. Index follows (fol. 79r-83r).3. fol. 114r-147v: Praxis Curiae. In foro Ecclesiastico primum impetranda est Citatio sub sigillo Iudicis... quae subterfugia et dilationes evitabis si consentias de procedendo in negotio principali omisso negotio appellis ut preferibitur. Index follows (fol. 148r-v).
Copied in part by Richard Sowerbutts.

MS 3327, Container 91: John Jarsey, his name on flyleaves and mentioned in the accounts; owned in the 19th century by the Rt. Hon. Frederick John Lord Monson of Burton Hall in Lincolnshire, probably included in the Monson sale at Christie, Manson, and Woods in London, 14-15 May, 1889; acquired by the Ransom Center in 1973 (R5374) from Jenkins and Company. Binding: (England? 19th c?) Full brown tanned calfskin over paper boards. Pulled-over caps, cut edges brush-colored red, hollow tube, four false raised bands. Two-line and decorative roll blind-tooled border, front and back covers; two-line gold-tooled filets across spine at head and tail and either side of raised bands; blind-tooled roll on board edges, turn-ins. Red tanned goatskin gold-tooled title label on spine (2d panel). Sewing/sewing supports not visible. Endbands worked on textile, stuck-on. Endleaf components: front tipped fold dark green wove paper making pastedown, free endleaf; back same.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts Collection.
